properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 2 at 9:43PM AKST until March 4 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one
quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 1 to
3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph.

* WHERE...Thompson Pass.

* WHEN...From 3 PM Tuesday to 6 PM AKST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously
cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite
on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will reduce visibility to
around one half mile at times tonight into Tuesday. As winds
increase during the afternoon, expect blowing snow to intensify
and reduce visibility to less than one quarter mile.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay
with your vehicle.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM TUESDAY TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS
